intro: Pseudostenosiphonium diandrum, commonly known as the two-lobed liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, terrestrial plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a thalloid structure with a leafy stem and is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves. It reproduces through spores, which are produced in specialized structures called soridia. Pseudostenosiphonium diandrum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
